conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on both the wooden block P and the long wooden board ab.
The weight of the block P is mg.
The normal force exerted by the board ab on the block P is N_P = mg.

premise: The normal force exerted by the board ab on the block P is N_P = mg.
conclusion: The kinetic frictional force exerted by the board ab on the block P is f_{kP} = μ_2 N_P = μ_2 mg.
The direction of the kinetic frictional force f_{kP} is opposite to the direction of motion of P, i.e., to the left.
The weight of the board ab is Mg.

premise: The weight of the board ab is Mg and the weight of the block P is mg.
conclusion: The normal force exerted by the ground on the board ab is N_{ab} = (M + m)g.

premise: The kinetic frictional force exerted by the board ab on the block P is f_{kP} = μ_2 mg.
conclusion: The kinetic frictional force exerted by the block P on the board ab is f_{kab} = μ_2 mg.
The direction of the kinetic frictional force f_{kab} is to the right.
The static frictional force exerted by the ground on the board ab is f_s.

premise: Since the board ab is stationary, the net force acting on it must be zero.
conclusion: The static frictional force f_s exerted by the ground on the board ab must balance the kinetic frictional force f_{kab} exerted by the block P on the board ab.

premise: The static frictional force f_s must balance the kinetic frictional force f_{kab}.
conclusion: The static frictional force f_s is equal in magnitude but opposite in direction to the kinetic frictional force f_{kab}: f_s = μ_2 mg.

premise: The static frictional force f_s is equal in magnitude to the kinetic frictional force f_{kab}: f_s = μ_2 mg.
conclusion: The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is μ_2 mg.
